dialogue_line_replacements.translation: Good morning. What is your name?

dialogue_line_replacements.text: Soy de Colombia. ¿Por qué tú me preguntas?
dialogue_line_replacements.translation: I'm from Colombia. Why do you ask?

dialogue_line_replacements.text: Llevo tres días. ¿Dónde está la salida?
dialogue_line_replacements.translation: I've been here three days. Where is the exit?

cultural_notes_overrides.formality: In Puerto Rico, subject pronouns appear frequently in questions and statements: '¿Cómo tú te llamas?' rather than '¿Cómo te llamas?' This is a defining feature of Caribbean Spanish and sounds natural, not redundant.
cultural_notes_overrides.gestures: In Puerto Rico, lip-pointing (discussed in directions lesson) extends to answering questions about location — a pursed-lip gesture toward the direction is common.
cultural_notes_overrides.regional_variations: '¿Mande?' is not used in Puerto Rico. Puerto Ricans use '¿Qué?' or '¿Cómo?' to ask someone to repeat. '¿Verdad?' (right? / isn't it?) is used as a tag question constantly in PR conversation.
